data.title: Petäjävesi Old Church
data.text: The Petjvesi Old Church () is a wooden church located in Petjvesi, Finland. It was built between 1763 and 1765, when Tavastia was still a part of Sweden. The bell tower was built in 1821. It was inscribed in 1994 on the UNESCO World Heritage List for its testimony to the wooden church architecture of the Nordic countries.The church is located about to the west of the centre of Petjvesi. It is a popular church for weddings in the summer, and there is a church service on most Sundays.History and Construction.
